thread.title: Sequence Celebrates 10 Years of Delivering Connected Experiences and Digital Products for Leading and Emerging Brands
thread.title_full: Sequence Celebrates 10 Years of Delivering Connected Experiences and Digital Products for Leading and Emerging Brands

author: admin
title: Sequence Celebrates 10 Years of Delivering Connected Experiences and Digital Products for Leading and Emerging Brands
text:
Submitted by admin on 9/3/2015 @ 8:00 AM   Sequence 
SAN FRANCISCO -- (BUSINESS WIRE) -- Today Sequence , an independent agency that designs and develops connected experiences for the world’s best-known and most innovative brands, celebrates its 10 th anniversary. Its roster of long-term clients includes Chipotle Mexican Grill, Chevron, Apple and The Ellen Show. Sequence has designed and developed marquee experiences for these companies as well as category-defining innovators like OpenTable, Google Ventures, Google X, Sonos and Roku. 
Over the last 10 years, Sequence has evolved its service offerings and processes to help its clients connect with their customers in new and meaningful ways. In a sensor-filled, smartphone-connected world, Sequence has worked with clients to conceive, design and develop holistic connected experiences that thoughtfully integrate digital elements, physical spaces and front-line personnel. 
The foundation of Sequence’s success is a talented team of 75 people in San Francisco and New York City who have backgrounds in strategy, interaction design, visual design, copywriting, motion design, software development and project management. Fueled by an operating philosophy that embraces change, Sequence has seen an average annual client and staff growth of 35 percent since 2005. 
Key Sequence Milestones: 
2005: Company founded in San Francisco2008: Designed Chevron.com, named best brand building site of the year by Forrester2009: Created first nationwide restaurant ordering app for iPhone for Chipotle2011: Established relationship with Apple2012: Opened second studio in New York City2013: Designed retail service experience pilot programs for Best Buy2014: Established Heads Up! game development partnership with The Ellen Show 
“Since day one, Sequence has stayed focused on creating high-impact experiences that deeply engage customers and increase brand value,” stated Jojo Roy, chief executive officer of Sequence. “To accomplish this, we’ve evolved continuously over the past ten years. From branding and web design to designing and building first mobile and now connected experiences, Sequence helps each client partner look ahead to shape its brand’s complete customer experience—across a full spectrum of touch points integrating the real, analog world with the borderless, digital world.” 
Looking forward to 2025, Sequence plans to be a key partner to existing and new clients who strive to deliver outstanding brand experiences that are both personal and in tune with a rapidly evolving world where billions of people and devices are in the midst of a trillion sensors. 
The company expresses gratitude to its anchor clients who have trusted and stood by Sequence for years including Chevron, Chipotle and Apple; it thanks its talented team of 75 employees; and appreciates the efforts of strategic partners like Vinsol. Meet the current team and explore work and insights from the past decade at Sequence.com. 
About Sequence 
Sequence is an independent agency that designs and develops connected experiences by launching new brands, digital products and service experiences that improve people’s lives and grow businesses. From strategy to design to development, the 75-person Sequence team delivers complete and compelling experiences for the world’s best-known and most innovative companies including Apple, Chevron, Chipotle Mexican Grill and The Ellen Show. For more information, visit Sequence.com or find us @sequenceSF. View source version on businesswire.com: http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20150903005477/en/ Copyright © Business Wire 2015
